name: Fake SBI Net-Banking Portal Phishing
description: Scammer impersonates State Bank of India sending alerts about restricted internet banking access due to unusual activity, directing victims to a fake net-banking login page to steal credentials and account details.

turns.scammer_message: Dear SBI Customer, your internet banking access has been restricted due to unusual activity. Click below to verify your identity and restore access immediately.
turns.notes: Initial scare message about restricted banking access without sharing extractable data.

turns.scammer_message: To restore your SBI internet banking access, please verify your identity through our secure portal: http://sbi-netbanking-secure.com/login. You will need your account number and registered mobile number for verification. This is a mandatory security check by SBI.
turns.notes: Scammer shares fake SBI net-banking login page to harvest credentials.

turns.scammer_message: We have detected a suspicious transaction of Rs 48,750 from your account number 4455667788990011. If this was not authorized by you, please verify immediately at http://sbi-netbanking-secure.com/login to block further unauthorized access and secure your funds.
turns.notes: Scammer reveals bank account number and resends phishing link with fake fraud alert.

turns.scammer_message: If you are unable to access the verification portal, please contact our SBI Fraud Prevention Cell at +91-7700889966. Our security team is investigating the unauthorized activity on account 4455667788990011 and needs your immediate cooperation to prevent further losses.
turns.notes: Scammer provides fake fraud helpline number and repeats bank account for credibility.

turns.scammer_message: CRITICAL ALERT: Two more unauthorized transactions detected on your SBI account. Total suspicious amount: Rs 1,23,500. Your account will be frozen within 1 hour if verification is not completed. Call +91-7700889966 or visit http://sbi-netbanking-secure.com/login NOW. Do not ignore this message.
turns.notes: Final turn with maximum urgency, repeating phone number and phishing link with escalated threat.
